column5: I havent posted a fish in a while, because, well, i havent fished in a while. My girlfriend and I just bought a house together, and we have been really busy feathering our nest. She has never fished before, but has always shown an interest in trying it. Well, this past weekend the timeing was right, and i called my bud Mike Rousseau, and we headed out for a mixed day of Musky and walleye. I had shown Natalie pics of Musky and told her as much as i dared so she wouldnt get scared, but when her rod got hit, she almost jumped out of her seat, Here is her very first fish ever. A fish of a lifetime !!!!!     53 inches of BEAST !!! Now to get a scale, Mike is 6'5" Natalie is 5'. That fish was 7 inches shorter than her  Sorry for the pic quality, in all the excitement, i didnt realize the sun was in the foreground  Couple of shots, and back she went. Cool water temps made for a quick release, and after trailng her for a few minutes to protect her on the surface while she caught her breath, she swam off back to her lair. I was ecstatic, and my girl friend was shakeing with excitement.Me......Out fished again as usual She like that, but she really had fun with the walleye. She had 5 caught before i caught my first, but all in all we boated 22 walleye and 6 smallies. We kept a limit of good eaters, and released the rest.    By the way....Natalie accepted my marriage proposal back in May, and we are sheduled to wed next June or July. Its never ever too late to find your soulmate !!! Hope you all enjoy this  Paul
What a haul, I think my girlfriend would die hahaha, hopefully I can get one like this when I go to st Clair in September!
That's just not fair! I think you got the better catch, though. Congrats on both counts!
Wow, that's some kinda nice first fish!!!
What a gentlemen letting her bring in the big fish! haha.
nice first fish giant ski congrats
You got smoked by your gal.  you'll be hearing that for a long time.  congrats on the engagement  may you fish happily ever after
Wow what a beast for a first fish! Congrats on catching a 60"er too Paul!

Had a great time Paul... And your lady did well... Fighting a fish like that in 30+km/hour winds in open water is very challenging....  Im just trying to get those pics fixed if that's possible... I'd love it if she could have a clearer shot of her trophy...

That's amazing !!!! First fishing trip and a trophy too boot !!!!! And even caught dinner as well !!!! Congrats on the getting married part as well Paul !!!! That's an incredible fishery down that way and I got to get down there and do some myself !!!! Cheers ..... I guess you will have a fishing partner from now on !!!! She is hooked for sure !!!  Cheers

Thanks everyone !! She actually prefers to fish Walleye now. She said it was "NEAT" to feel them tapping the lure, then grabbing it and running ! She's a wicked tough little woman. Custom made just for me
Nice job guys! Beautiful musky. Got a pretty nice one too on Saturday myself.
you set that bar pretty high with helping her catch that monster!!!  Congrats on the engagement.  Happy wife, happy life!  Nick
No help catching it   She chose the lure, and didn't think twice about grabbing the rod and hauling the big girl in!! Said her arms were still sore this morning too
Paul, Very happy to hear things are going your way  Simon
Thanks Simon !!! Hope all is going well with you and Sean and your whole family !!
some guys will do anything to get a positive answer to marriage...lol...Congrates Paul...you two do have alot in common ...your both learning to fish....  All the best for the future events!!!
Sweet.  Gonna be tough to beat that.  High-fives and congrats on a great catch
Thanks Rich !! Considering its 5 inches longer than my biggest, it may take me some time to top. She did however, let me know that mine was prettier LOL !!!
